amendment.description: Amendment provides an additional $1,000,000 to the Drug-Free Communities Program account to support local governments critical opioid response efforts in communities hit hardest by the opioid crisis and makes a corresponding reduction in the General Services Administration sub-account for the rental of space.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 27 printed in Part B of House Report 116-126 to provide an additional $1,000,000 to the Drug-Free Communities Program account to support local governments critical opioid response efforts in communities hit hardest by the opioid crisis and makes a corresponding reduction in the General Services Administration sub-account for the rental of space.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Lee (NV) amendment (A016) Agreed to by recorded vote: 400 - 27 (Roll no. 419).

action.text: House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Lee (NV) amendment (A016) Agreed to by recorded vote: 400 - 27 (Roll no. 419).
Roll call votes on amendments in House
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A016) offered by Mrs. Lee (NV).
